question: The followers of which religion are called the “Hynniew Trep”?
explanation: Seng Khasi was founded in Meghalaya on 23<sup>rd</sup> November 1899. The term “Seng” means beginning or foundation and “Khasis” are the indigenous people in the area. The followers of this religion are called “Hynniew Trep” (seven huts). Each year, the festival called Lympung is celebrated to commemorate the founding of the religion.
